creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Court robe of puce colored k'ossu with diaper ground of quatrefoil medallions, enclosing narcissus blossom, and swastikas in gold threads. Nine 5-clawed dragons, those in profile clutching the Heavenly Jewel. In the ground loose clouds, bats, Taoist emblems, and peonies in shades of blue, and tones of white. Conventional border of straight-edged slanting stripes in shades of blue alternating with gold threads; tight clouds; rolling waves and spray in which are scattered swastikas and Taoist emblems. Below the border on sleeves a strip of black silk damask of medallion design. Cuffs and collarband of dark blue k'ossu with dragons, clouds, bats, etc. Edging of dark blue and gold brocade. Painted details. Robe slit front and back and lined with blue satin damask of floral design.
title: Court Robe
